headline.print_headline: Insurers Alter Cost Formula; Patients Pay
headline.seo: Health Insurers Switch Baseline for Out-of-Network Charges
headline.main: Insurers Alter Cost Formula, and Patients Pay More

docs.snippet: After compiling a database of customary rates for medical procedures, many insurance companies switched to a calculation based on Medicare rates, meaning higher costs for patients....
docs.abstract: Nation's largest health insurers have been switching to a new payment method that in most cases increases costs to the patient, despite landmark 2009 settlement with New York State that was expected to increase coverage for out-of-network care; though settlement required companies to underwrite a new database of customary doctors' fees with $95 million, it did not obligate them to use it; so companies nationwide rapidly shifted to another calculation method, based on Medicare rates, that usually reduces reimbursement substantially.
docs.lead_paragraph: After compiling a database of customary rates for medical procedures, many insurance companies switched to a calculation based on Medicare rates, meaning higher costs for patients.

headline.print_headline: To Curb Rowdiness, Long Island Rail Road Will Ban Alcohol on Late-Night Weekend Trains
headline.seo: L.I.R.R. to Ban Alcohol on Late-Night Weekend Trains
headline.main: To Curb Rowdiness, Long Island Rail Road Will Ban Alcohol on Late-Night Weekend Trains

docs.snippet: Three people have been accused of attacking conductors in the last month....
docs.abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority is set to test a ban that will prohibit riders from bringing alcoholic drinks onto Long Island Rail Road trains leaving Pennsylvania Station on Friday and Saturday nights between midnight and 5 am; rule is to curb drunken fights and boisterous behavior that are on the rise and threaten the safety of passengers and conductors.
docs.lead_paragraph: Three people have been accused of attacking conductors in the last month.

headline.print_headline: George Rathmann, Amgen Chief, Dies at 84
headline.seo: George Rathmann, Chief of Amgen, Dies at 84
headline.main: George Rathmann, Amgen Chief, Dies at 84

docs.snippet: Dr. Rathmann oversaw Amgen as it developed what would become two of the most successful drugs in history and became the world’s largest biotechnology company....
docs.abstract: George B Rathmann, who was the first chief executive of Amgen and helped build it into the world’s largest biotechnology company, dies at age 84.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Rathmann oversaw Amgen as it developed what would become two of the most successful drugs in history and became the world’s largest biotechnology company.

docs.snippet: MetLife on Monday became the third big life insurer to settle regulatory accusations of failing to keep track of policyholder deaths, trapping money that should have gone promptly to the beneficiaries....
docs.abstract: MetLife becomes the third big life insurer to settle regulatory accusations of failing to keep track of policyholder deaths, trapping money that should have gone promptly to the beneficiaries; agrees to pay states a total of $40 million in a negotiated settlement; also expects to release about $188 million to beneficiaries around the country in 2012.
docs.lead_paragraph: MetLife on Monday became the third big life insurer to settle regulatory accusations of failing to keep track of policyholder deaths, trapping money that should have gone promptly to the beneficiaries.

docs.snippet: The Nebraska Legislature has sent the message that promoting healthy pregnancies is more important than fretting over a woman’s immigration status....
docs.abstract: Editorial praises the Nebraska Legislature for overriding Gov Dave Heineman's veto of a bill to provide free prenatal care to undocumented immigrant women; notes that result was brought about by an unlikely alliance between women's health advocates and anti-abortion groups who feel that unborn children do not yet have an immigration status.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Nebraska Legislature has sent the message that promoting healthy pregnancies is more important than fretting over a woman’s immigration status.

headline.seo: Cody Ross Homers Twice as Red Sox Top Twins and End Five-Game Skid

docs.snippet: Cody Ross homered twice, tying the game with a two-run shot in the seventh and giving Boston the lead with two outs in the ninth to snap a five-game losing streak with a win over Minnesota....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Boston Red Sox snap five-game losing streak, beating the Minnesota Twins, 6-5; other MLB scores noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Cody Ross homered twice, tying the game with a two-run shot in the seventh and giving Boston the lead with two outs in the ninth to snap a five-game losing streak with a win over Minnesota.

docs.snippet: On the question of equal pay for women, Mitt Romney’s commitment to fairness is going to be tested....
docs.abstract: Editorial scores Mitt Romney for his serial reversals on the question of equal pay for women; notes that Romney has promised not to repeal equal pay legislation as president, while openly praising politicians and Supreme Court justices who seek to do so; encourages Romney to openly support the Senate's Paycheck Fairness Act.
docs.lead_paragraph: On the question of equal pay for women, Mitt Romney’s commitment to fairness is going to be tested.

headline.print_headline: Occupy Movement Looks Toward Political Conventions
headline.seo: Occupy Movement Prepares for Democratic Convention
headline.main: Occupy Movement Looks Toward Political Conventions

docs.snippet: Members of the Occupy movement in Charlotte, N.C., are preparing for the Democratic National Convention in September, but they have been beset by troubles....
docs.abstract: Members of the Occupy movement in Charlotte, NC, are planning several protests, including one at the Democratic National Convention in September 2012, despite its past problems with leadership infighting, repeated public relations gaffes and a ban on camping by authorities.
docs.lead_paragraph: Members of the Occupy movement in Charlotte, N.C., are preparing for the Democratic National Convention in September, but they have been beset by troubles.

headline.main: For Bocce, a New Generation of Devotees

docs.snippet: A dusty old game favored by Italian old-timers has evolved into a trendy social sport — one largely without taxing physical demands....
docs.lead_paragraph: A dusty old game favored by Italian old-timers has evolved into a trendy social sport — one largely without taxing physical demands.

headline.print_headline: A Would-Be Shoe Bomber Testifies in a Terror Trial
headline.seo: At Adis Medunjanin’s Terror Trial, 2nd Would-Be Shoe Bomber Testifies
headline.main: A Would-Be Shoe Bomber Testifies in a Terror Trial

docs.snippet: Saajid Badat was heard via video in the case against Adis Medunjanin, a Queens man accused in a plot to blow up New York subways....
docs.abstract: Saajid Badat testifies by video to his role in a shoe-bombing conspiracy in the terrorism trial of Adis Medunjanin, Queens man accused of being involved in a separate plot to blow up New York City subways.
docs.lead_paragraph: Saajid Badat was heard via video in the case against Adis Medunjanin, a Queens man accused in a plot to blow up New York subways.
